intro: Cyrtandra apaensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas. Cyrtandra apaensis is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
